api

Class WebSocketServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • api.WebSocketServlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer

    public class WebSocketServlet
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Observer
    The Class WebSocketServlet. The purpose is to communicate the Java Logic for processing a video with an html UI. It uses a Jetty's JSR-356 WebSocket to establish a connection with one User. For every new user, a new instance of the class is generated.

    • Method Detail

      • openSession

        public void openSession(javax.websocket.Session session,
                        javax.websocket.EndpointConfig conf)
        Open. Method executed when a session is opened.
        Parameters:
        session - the current user's session
        conf - the configuration sent by the client

      • processUpload

        public void processUpload(java.nio.ByteBuffer msg,
                          boolean last,
                          javax.websocket.Session session)
        Process upload. Method executed when a client sends an buffer of bytes. It writes the chunks sent by the client.
        Parameters:
        msg - the buffer of bytes sent by the client
        last - the parameter needed for the standard defined by the Jetty JSR-356
        session - the clients current session

      • onMessage

        public void onMessage(javax.websocket.Session session,
                      java.lang.String msg)
        On message. Method executed when a message comes from the client
        Parameters:
        session - the clients current session
        msg - the message sent by the client

      • close

        public void close(javax.websocket.Session session,
                  javax.websocket.CloseReason reason)
        Close. Method executed when a client's session is closed, needed for standard
        Parameters:
        session - the client's closed session
        reason - the reason why it closed, normally just disconnected.

      • error

        public void error(javax.websocket.Session session,
                  java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Error. A type of catch within a socket's connection
        Parameters:
        session - the client's session with
        throwable - the java's throwable error
